message_1: A Caesar cipher is a simple encryption technique that shifts each letter of the alphabet by a certain number of places. If a message "HELLO" is encrypted using a Caesar Cipher with a shift of 3, the encrypted message becomes "KHOOR". If a message "MATH" is encrypted with a Caesar Cipher with a shift of 7, what is the encrypted message?
message_2:
To encrypt the message "MATH" with a Caesar Cipher with a shift of 7, we will shift each letter 7 positions forward in the alphabet.

M -> T (M + 7)
A -> H (A + 7)
T -> A (T + 7, wrapping around the alphabet)
H -> O (H + 7)

So, the encrypted message is "THAO".
